comp102x

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp102x.Canvas

  • public class Canvas
extends java.lang.Object
    The Canvas class provides method for showing images on a canvas area.
    Author:
    leofan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_HEIGHT 
      static int DEFAULT_WIDTH 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Canvas()
      Constructs and shows a canvas with size 800 x 600.
      Canvas(int width, int height)
      Constructs and shows a canvas with specific width and height.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds a canvas object to the canvas at position (0, 0).

      Adds a canvas object to the canvas at position (x, y).
      void addMouseListener(java.awt.event.MouseListener listener)
      Registers a java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener object to the canvas.

      Registers a java.awt.event.MouseListener object to the canvas.

      Returns the height of the canvas.

      Returns the width of the canvas.

      Gets the JPanel of the canvas.

      Removes a specific canvas object that is added to the canvas.

      Removes all canvas objects on the canvas.

      Adds a JComponent at the bottom of the canvas.

      Adds a JComponent at the top of the canvas.

      Sets if the canvas is resizable.

        public Canvas(int width,
      int height)

        width - The width of the canvas to be constructed.
        height - The height of the canvas to be constructed.

      • add

        public void add(CanvasObject canvasObject)
        Adds a canvas object to the canvas at position (0, 0).
        Parameters:
        canvasObject - The canvas object to be added (e.g. barcode, colorimage, text)

      • add

        public void add(CanvasObject canvasObject,
       int x,
       int y)
        Adds a canvas object to the canvas at position (x, y).
        Parameters:
        canvasObject - The canvas object to be added (e.g. barcode, colorimage, text).
        x - The x position of the canvas object.
        y - The y position of the canvas object.

      • setComponentAtTop

        public void setComponentAtTop(javax.swing.JComponent component)

      • setComponentAtBottom

        public void setComponentAtBottom(javax.swing.JComponent component)
        Adds a JComponent at the bottom of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        component - The JComponent to be added.

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        Removes all canvas objects on the canvas. The canvas will show the default background color after removal.

      • remove

        public void remove(CanvasObject canvasObject)
        Removes a specific canvas object that is added to the canvas.
        Parameters:
        canvasObject - The canvas object to be removed from the canvas.

        Registers a java.awt.event.MouseListener object to the canvas.
        Parameters:
        listener - the MouseListener object to be registered.
